alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 6:20PM MST until March 23 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy rain and melting snow have lead to fast rising flows in the Verde River, which will remain at critical levels. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 600 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of the Verde River and tributary creeks and normally dry washes is occurring. Deadly flooding over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 PM MST, stream gauge reports indicated water levels continue to rise on the Verde River upstream of Camp Verde. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area, and additional river level rises are possible this evening. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Verde River, Beaver Creek, Bull Run Creek, Cherry Creek, Gaddis Wash, West Clear Creek, Grief Hill Wash and Chasm Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camp Verde and Middle Verde. - This includes the following highways... State Route 260 between mile markers 217 and 218...and between mile markers 220 and 222. Interstate 17 between mile markers 288 and 289. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report any flooding to local law enforcement and the NWS Flagstaff when you can do so safely.
